metadata.feature_description: Award points for wiki activities like creating articles, commenting, and interactions

steps.expected: User profile page loads with points display visible
steps.actual: User profile page loaded successfully showing SuperUser Account with Points: 218 displayed prominently alongside Friends, Following, and Followers counts

steps.expected: Leaderboard page loads showing ranked users with reputation points
steps.actual: Leaderboard page loaded successfully showing table with columns: Rank, Member Name, Reputation Points, Badge, Member Since. Test User123 shown at Rank 1 with 601 Reputation Points. Multiple users displayed with their points and badges.

steps.action: Navigate to Community Activities page (Home/Activities) to view scoring actions
steps.expected: Activities page shows Wiki-related scoring actions with point values
steps.actual: Activities page loaded showing 60 total scoring activities. Wiki-specific scoring actions confirmed: Created article (5 points), Edited article (1 point), Associated article metadata (1 point), Edited article metadata (1 point), Facebook Share Wiki (1 point), Google Share Wiki (1 point), LinkedIn Share Wiki (1 point). Top Contributors sidebar also displayed.

steps.action: View Top Contributors section on Community page
steps.expected: Top Contributors widget displays users ranked by points
steps.actual: Top Contributors widget visible on Community page showing ranked users including Test User123, Test User10, Test Admin, Regular TestUser, and others. Widget links to full Leaderboard page.

observations: Code review confirms Wiki scoring actions are defined in Mechanics.cs with point values: CreatedArticle (5 rep/5 exp), EditedArticle (1 rep/1 exp), CreatedMetaData (1 rep/1 exp), EditedMetaData (1 rep/1 exp)
Negative scoring also implemented for deleted/flagged articles: CreatedDeletedArticle (-5 rep), CreatedFlaggedArticle (-1 rep)
Privilege system based on reputation: CreateArticles (10 pts), EditMetadata (50 pts), EditContentUnmoderated (100 pts)
SuperUser Account shows 218 points accumulated from various activities
Scoring is integrated through SocialMechanicsController.Instance.LogUserActivity() in ContentController.cs and SocialController.cs
